message.content:
1) What should the UI look like? The UI should feature a segment of text that is visually underlined to emphasize or highlight it. This can be used within paragraphs, labels, or any other textual content where emphasis is required. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - UnderlinedText (Standalone): A component that renders a span of text with an underline. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html

Here is some text with in it.

``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - UnderlinedText: ```html {text} ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature a small, styled card or element that demonstrates an inner shadow effect. This adds a sense of depth by giving the impression that the content is inset within the element rather than elevated above it. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **InsetShadowBox**: A standalone component that is styled with an inner shadow effect using CSS. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **InsetShadowBox**: ```html
{children}
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI consists of a table displaying data with a set of pagination controls below it. The table should be clearly visible with headers that distinguish each column. The pagination controls will include buttons to navigate to the first, previous, next, and last pages, as well as input for jumping to a specific page. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **DataTable**: Standalone component containing the table with data. - **PaginationControls**: Standalone component containing the pagination buttons and page input. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **DataTable**: ```html
Header 1 Header 2 Header 3
Data 1 Data 2 Data 3
``` - **PaginationControls**: ```html
Previous Next

Showing {from} to {to} of {total} results

First Previous Next Last
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI for product pagination typically includes navigation buttons or links to allow users to browse through multiple pages of products. It should show a series of numbered page links, and it may also include "Previous" and "Next" buttons to navigate to adjacent pages. The pagination should be centered at the bottom of the product listing page for clear visibility. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **PaginationContainer**: Standalone component that houses the whole pagination UI. - **PageLink**: Standalone component that represents individual page links. - **NavigationButton**: Standalone component used for "Previous" and "Next" navigation buttons. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **PaginationContainer** ```html
{children}
``` - **PageLink** ```html {page_number} ``` - **NavigationButton** ```html ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI for the navigation menu should consist of a horizontal layout for desktop views, which collapses into a vertical layout for mobile views. The menu will include several links, each representing different sections of a website. The focus will be on simplicity and readability, ensuring that the navigation is accessible across all devices. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **NavigationBar (Standalone)**: This is the container for the entire navigation menu. - **NavItem (Standalone)**: Represents an individual menu item. This component might contain a text label and possibly an active state to indicate the current page. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html Home About Services Contact ``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **NavigationBar HTML**: ```html
{children}
``` - **NavItem HTML**: ```html {children} ``` For the `NavItem` component, `{nav_item_link}` would be replaced by the actual URL corresponding to each navigation item text (e.g., `/home`, `/about`, etc.). Each `NavItem` could have different `{nav_item_link}` values depending on the page it links to.

1) What should the UI look like? - The UI should display a search result item which includes a title, a brief description, and a link to read more. It should be formatted neatly, ensuring it's clearly distinguishable as an individual search result within a list. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - SearchResultItem (Standalone): Displays the search result including the title, description, and a "Read More" link. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **SearchResultItem**: ```html

{title}

{description}

Read More
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should display scattered confetti pieces on the screen, creating a celebratory presentation. The confetti should be of various colors and sizes to mimic a dynamic, festive atmosphere. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **ConfettiPiece**: Standalone component. This represents a single piece of confetti. - **ConfettiWrapper**: Component that takes children. This acts as a container for multiple ConfettiPiece components to create an ensemble of confetti. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **HTML for ConfettiPiece**: ```html
``` - **HTML for ConfettiWrapper**: ```html
{children}
``` Here `{color}` should be a tailwindcss color class like `red-500`, `{rotation_degrees}` should be a number indicating degrees of rotation like `45`, `{top_percentage}` and `{left_percentage}` should be numbers representing the positioning of each ConfettiPiece on the screen within the wrapper, measured as a percentage of the wrapper's dimensions.

1) What should the UI look like? - The UI should feature a horizontal navigation menu bar at the top of the page. This bar will include links to different pages. It should be visually clean and modern, with each navigation link easily clickable. On smaller screens, the navigation links might be collapsed into a hamburger menu for better accessibility and to save space. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **NavBar**: A standalone component that hosts the entire navigation layout. - **NavLinks**: A component that takes children; it will contain the individual links. - **HamburgerMenu**: A standalone component visible on smaller screens for displaying a collapsible menu. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html

{brand_name}

  • Home
  • About
  • Services
  • Contact
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **NavBar**: ```html
{children}
``` - **NavLinks**: ```html
{children}
``` - **HamburgerMenu**: ```html ```

1) What should the UI look like? The UI should consist of a clearly labeled input field that is designed for keyboard input. This input field should be easily accessible and prominently displayed on the page, providing a straightforward interface for users to type in text. Additionally, the field should be accompanied by helper text or a label that closely describes its function or purpose. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **InputField**: Standalone component. This component serves as the text input area where users will type their data. - **InputLabel**: Standalone component. This is a label element that describes the associated input field. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **InputLabel**: ```html ``` - **InputField**: ```html ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should consist of a gallery of images displayed in a grid format. Each image can be clicked to view a larger version. There should be a modal overlay that displays the full-size image when any image in the gallery is clicked. The modal should have a close button to exit the view. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **GridGallery**: Standalone component; it displays images in a grid layout. - **ModalOverlay**: Component that takes children; it is used to display the larger version of an image along with a close button. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **GridGallery**: ```html
``` - **ModalOverlay**: ```html
{children}
```
